It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and cliffs. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
